item.title: Building a fat libSDL.a for iOS development
item.description: Updated 2017-11-19: Rewrote for clarity and removed references to the 32-bit simulator which has been removed from the default install as of Xcode 9 For iOS development it is handy to have a single SDL2 library that supports both the simulator and the physical device. This is how to create a libSDL2.a that can be used for both. Step 1: Build libSDL2.a for each target Download the SDL2 source from the official SDL website and verify the integrity of the source package using GPG.
